entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is described as leaving the tent early in the morning to search for a tree, indicating he is taking initiative and responsibility.

entities.name: mad-eye moody
entities.description: Mad-Eye Moody's eye is buried by Harry, suggesting that Mad-Eye is no longer present or has passed away.

entities.name: dolores umbridge
entities.description: Dolores Umbridge is mentioned as having Mad-Eye's eye stuck on her door, indicating she is a person of authority or power.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is described as removing enchantments and helping Harry and Ron clean up the campsite, showing her resourcefulness and teamwork skills.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron agrees with Harry and Hermione's plan to leave the clearing, indicating he is a team player and willing to follow their lead.

relationships.description: Harry buried Mad-Eye Moody's eye in the tree, indicating a connection between Harry and Mad-Eye.
Harry prefers to bury Mad-Eye's eye rather than have it stuck on Dolores Umbridge's door, indicating a desire to avoid her.
Harry and Hermione work together to clean up the campsite and plan their next move, showing a collaborative relationship between them.
Harry and Ron agree on their next move, indicating a level of trust and agreement between them.
